Seafood paellaNext to the shore of the seaQuite pleasant for meCame to Salamanca at the recommendation of my Yelp friend, Charlene L.  Close to  five stars, but not quite.We arrived there about 6 PM and the place was pretty empty.  Cab driver thought we were totally nuts for eating at such an early hour.  Got seated on their large outdoor patio which has the Mediterranean Sea for its backyard.  By the time we left at about 8, the place was starting to fill up.All but one of us went with the seafood paella.  Some of the best that I have ever had, but I have not had a whole lot.  Tons of flavorful seafood.  My only complaint is that the rice was a little bit crunchy for my 'murican tastes.Had a couple pitchers of the Sangria, both red and white.  Tasty and potent.  You should leave stuffed after finishing your meal at Salamanca.  Luckily, the beach is about 50 feet away and you can walk off some of your meal.
